entry.title: End Poem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Julian Gough wrote in Minecraft's End Poem that "you are love" (quotation pictured), and then released the poem into the public domain after a psilocybin trip prompted him to heed that message?

entry.title: Willow Kayne (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that future Loud LDN member Willow Kayne went into music after temporarily losing her sight?

entry.title: Turtle River–White Otter Lake Provincial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the White Otter Castle is the most popular attraction in the Turtle River–White Otter Lake Provincial Park, even though it is not accessible by road?

entry.title: went on strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that up to 129,000 Canadian federal workers went on strike?

entry.title: R v ACR Roofing Pty Ltd (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in R v ACR Roofing Pty Ltd the Victorian Court of Appeal held that workers do not need to be employed by a company to hold it liable for safety violations?

entry.title: Raymond Vohasek (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Raymond Vohasek led his college's football team in sacks even though he played the entire season with a torn labrum?

entry.title: Game Boy Advance version (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Game Boy Advance version of Broken Sword: The Shadow of the Templars was largely developed by just two people?

entry.title: Herbert Polzhuber (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the 1965 World Pentathlon Championships, Herbert Polzhuber was said to have drunk ten beers and a bottle of cognac before firing his pistol at the ground and passing out?
